main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were sighted near Batesville, Mississippi on July 17, 1952, by several witnesses.
interesting points: The objects were observed to be round and approximately 100 to 152 feet in diameter., Witnesses noted that the objects appeared to have a back-and-forth movement and could change direction abruptly., One witness described an object as looking like a full moon, white and round., The sighting lasted approximately 15 to 30 minutes, with objects at altitudes between 11,000 to 30,000 feet., No technical evidence was found to support the sighting, and there was no interception or identification attempted.
sighted object: two or three round unidentified flying objects
witness description: J. D. Watts and J. E. Cunliffe of the Mississippi State Highway Patrol; Lt Colonel Frank M. Allen, USAF and Captain J. Wm. Lyons, USAF
